hook.text: Muhammad Yunus lent $27 to 42 women in Bangladesh. It changed global finance forever.

discovery.text: Yunus created Grameen Bank: tiny loans to groups of women who guaranteed each other's repayment.

twist.text: Repayment rates exceeded 98%â€”better than any commercial bank. The poor were excellent borrowers.

climax.text: Yunus won the Nobel Peace Prize. Microcredit now reaches 140 million borrowers worldwide.

punchline.text: The poor didn't need charity. They needed a chance.
